title: Cap Streamers, 1770–90
medium:
Medium: linen, horsehair
Technique: needle lace
provenance: Ex-collection: Marie Antionette. Madame Vigee LeBrun painted her wearing them in the portrait that is now in Versailles. The queen gave the lappets to one of her ladies – Marie Adrienne Potain de Bagueux on the occasion of her marriage in 1778 to the architect Pierre Rousseau.
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Design shows serpentine garlands of small-scale flowers and leaves with connecting bow-knots in repeat pattern. Fond: réseau, cordonnet. Modes: portes.
